name: IA Attorney General
tweet: That must change. Today, I joined a bipartisan group of 44 AGs urging Snapchat and TikTok to immediately pursue parental control apps and to implement stronger parental controls and content moderation on their platforms.   Read our letter:  https://t.co/SvxhvNxLsw

name: IA Attorney General
tweet: Ensuring children are protected from online threats is vital. Yet, some social media platforms lack controls to do just that. Currently, TikTok & Snapchat do not effectively collaborate with parental control apps or otherwise provide opportunity for parental control.

name: IA Attorney General
tweet: Today, I join a coalition of AGs urging the @CFPB to prioritize robust consumer protections during its review of the BNPL loan industry. We lay out a number of concerns including how BNPL lenders disclose lending and repayment terms, and their collection and use of consumer data.

name: IA Attorney General
tweet: The buy now, pay later industry has experienced rapid and exponential growth in recent years. While these loans promise consumers a quick and easy way to pay for goods over a period of time, they can also push borrowers deeper into debt.

name: IA Attorney General
tweet: One of my top priorities has always been protecting consumers. Today, the sophistication and the seriousness of the threats facing consumers are unprecedented.   It was a pleasure to discuss these issues and our office's work with @PrivacyPros.    https://t.co/AEflHMgNrK
